Key Match Events: The Pirates blew a seven-run lead in the final three innings
Kyle Nicolas allowed a pair of runs, forcing the skipper to go to Aroldis Chapman
Chapman allowed three runs and needed to be lifted for Dennis Santana
David Bednar entered the ninth with a two-run lead but allowed one run and loaded the bases
Jalen Beeks allowed the two inherited runners to score, along with a run charged to himself
Christian Bethancourt lined an 0-1 fastball that shortstop Isiah Kiner-Falefa could only get a piece of before it trickled into left field to put Chicago ahead, 11-10
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Derek Shelton expressed his frustration after the game
Paul Skenes emphasized the importance of playing for each other
Bryan Reynolds, Connor Joe, and Isiah Kiner-Falefa called for the team to stick together and support each other
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Pirates have lost by one run eight times and blown a league-high seven saves in August
David Bednar’s ERA ballooned to 6.32 over 50 outings
Shelton would not comment on Bednar’s status as the team’s closer moving forward
Others: The Pirates have a day off tomorrow
The Pirates have a month left in the season
